I've never heard of cairo themes ....
you mean a theme called cairo?
how about this were are programs installed
I'm at the gnome-look site; how about a link to the one you're talking about
ah, cairo-dock theme. Like it says, ~/.cairo-doc/themes/
that's exactly where it's at. ~ is a shortcut for /home/<username>
then you most likely don't have cairo-dock installed. It's an alternate to the normal gnome panel
if you do, just create the directories:   mkdir -p ~/.cairo-doc/themes
if you have never manually edited /etc/* , making sure you have a backup of your home should transfer all your personal settings

and   sudo dpkg --get-selections > mypackages.txt , moving that file to the new machine after install, then sudo dpkg --get-selections < mypackages.txt && sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade will restore the software
that's sudo dpkg --set-selections < mypackages.txt as the second command
sudo dpkg --get-selections > mypackages.txt will get a list of all installed software, and save it in a file

then   sudo dpkg --set-selections < mypackages.txt will read that list, on the new machine, and set them up for installation.  sudo apt-get deselect-upgrade  will perform the actual download and install
